Some ways to manage anger might include:

1. Recognize the signs: Become aware of when you start feeling angry, so that you can intervene early.

2. Take a pause and breathe deeply: This helps calm your mind and gives time for rational thought before reacting impulsively.

3. Speak up calmly about what is causing the anger without blaming anyone or using accusatory language.

4. Exercise regularly, as physical activity often helps reduce stress and improve mood overall.

5. Express your feelings in writing instead of speaking out loud when angry; this can help put things into perspective and avoid escalation of conflict with others.

6.Minimize exposure to triggers such as specific situations or people that provoke rage frequently—avoid unnecessary conflicts whenever possible

7.Meditate daily or practice mindfulness techniques which can aid in stress reduction & better control over one's own emotions throughout day-to-day challenges

8.Seek professional therapy from a psychologist or another mental health expert who specializes in anger management strategies if necessary—they may offer additional guidance personalized specifically toward individual needs

9.Utilize relaxation methods including but not limited to deep breathing exercises, progressive muscle relaxation (PMR) & visualization techniques aimed at easing tension caused by pent-up frustration/anger energy levels within body systemically upon occurrence(s)

10.Develop healthy coping mechanisms that can serve as outlets—including exercise/yoga classes geared toward unwinding high-intensity emotional states during regular attendance thereof
